Package com.zoho.arattai.Message

Class AudioMessage

java.lang.Object
com.zoho.arattai.core.Message
com.zoho.arattai.Message.AudioMessage
public class AudioMessage extends Message
Represents a voice note or audio file attachment parsed from a WhatsApp chat export.

An AudioMessage is produced for any message whose attachment filename carries one of the following extensions: .opus, .ogg, .mp3, .wav, .m4a, or .aac. In addition, a bare "<Media omitted>" line is also treated as an audio message (matching WhatsApp's convention for voice notes that were not included in the export).

Duration extraction strategy (format-dependent):

  • Opus / OGG – The last OggS page header is located and its granule position is divided by the fixed Opus sample rate of 48 000 Hz. No external tools are required.
  • MP3 – Duration is read via the mp3agic library by examining the ID3 frame data and Xing / VBRI headers.
  • M4A / AAC – The mvhd (Movie Header) ISOBMFF box is located and the duration / timescale ratio is computed directly in Java.
  • All other formats default to "0:00".

All fields are immutable (public final) and initialised at construction time.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Zoho Arattai

  • Field Details

    • audioName

      public final String audioName
      The filename of the audio file as stored inside the export ZIP.

    • audioSize

      public final int audioSize
      The uncompressed file size of the audio in bytes.

    • audioDuration

      public final String audioDuration
      The playback duration of the audio clip, formatted as "m:ss" (e.g., "0:05"). Defaults to "0:00" when extraction fails.

    • audioType

      public final String audioType
      The lowercase file extension identifying the audio format (e.g., "opus", "mp3").

  • Constructor Details

    • AudioMessage

      public AudioMessage(String audioName, int audioSize, String audioDuration, String audioType, String sender, Date timestamp, Message.MessageType messageType)
      Constructs a new AudioMessage with all metadata provided by the parser.
      Parameters:
      audioName - the audio filename inside the ZIP; must not be null
      audioSize - the file size in bytes
      audioDuration - the playback duration as "m:ss"; must not be null
      audioType - the lowercase file extension; must not be null
      sender - the display name of the sender; must not be null
      timestamp - the date and time the message was sent; must not be null
      messageType - the type classification; expected to be Message.MessageType.AUDIO
